result.execSummary:
Gerald A. BIEBERITZ was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Gerald A. BIEBERITZ was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald A. BIEBERITZ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
At 1:35 p.m. $70,000.00 surety bond signed and defendant is released from custody.
Copy of house title.
Notice signed by defendant of his mandatory court appearance in Illinois on 12-30-14 at 8:45 a.m.

Defendant in custody.
The defendant does not contest the extradition back to the State of Illinois.
The Court explains to the defendant his right to an extradition hearing and governors warrant and finds that he has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived that right.
The defendant signs all copies of the waiver of extradition.
The Court signs all copies of the waiver of extradition.
Attorney Dietz argues for bail. The defendant wishes to appear in Illinois on his own and asks for bail to be set.
The State has no objection.
The Court will set a surety bond in the amount of $70,000.00 and will use the defendants house as surety.  The family is to provide the title to the house prior to release.
Waiver of Extradition.
(copies to DA, Jail, defendant, Illinois authorities, Attorney Dietz and Governor)
Minutes.
